page.title: 13PUNKY LANTERN,DALWOOD.
page.content: Punky Lantern night is a Halloween celebration held in Dalwood at the end of October each year. The children from the school make lanterns with mangles supplied by a local farmer. Some people use pumpkins which they have grown. The lanterns are lit by candles and there is an evening procession to the local hostelry, the Tucker's Arms. After the parade there is a spooky disco for the children in the skittle alley behind the pub.Some are dressed as witches, ghouls or spooks. The skittle alley is decorated with spiders and webs.The food is made to resemble frogs'legs, bats' wings(chicken),blood(tomato sauce), and sugar mice. Witches brew is made from lemonade and blackcurrant juice.
